des:
Your MagicLight WiFi lights now connect to your Amazon Echo family of devices through the Alexa connected home. After a few easy setup steps, you can control your lights with Alexa.

Once you know the name or group of your lights, you can say the following:
On/Off, Lights
 “Alexa, turn on bedroom light”
 “Alexa, turn off bedroom light”

Percentage, Dimmers
 “Alexa, set hallway light to 10 percent”
 “Alexa, brighten hallway light”
 “Alexa, dim family room”
 “Alexa, dim kitchen by 60 percent”
 “Alexa, brighten kitchen light by 80 percent”

Set Color
“Alexa, set the bedroom light to red”
“Alexa, change the kitchen to the color blue”


Make sure you have signed into your MagicLight cloud account and have enabled your MagicLight lights for remote control. Then follow these steps:

1. Enable this skill and link your MagicLight Wifi account. Make sure you have enabled Remote Access on your MagicLight Wifi bulbs in the MagicLight Wifi app.
2. Next, discover you MagicLight Wifi bulbs by saying "Alexa, Discover Devices" or by clicking the Discover Devices button in the Smart Home section of the Alexa app.
3. Your MagicLight Wifi bulbs should appear in your list of discovered devices using the name given in the MagicLight Wifi app
4. Now all setup is finished, you can simply ask Alexa to turn on, turn off or dimming the light. 


For more help, please refer to this link: https://www.magiclightbulbs.com/pages/alexa-integration
